intro: Achoriphragma darvazicum, commonly known as the Darvazicum spurge, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, showing adaptations to drought. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are often clustered in cyathia, a characteristic feature of the Euphorbiaceae family. The plant's leaves are usually alternate and have a rough texture, contributing to its survival in harsh conditions.
